columns.name: organisation_path
columns.dc:title: Organisation Path
columns.schema:description: A sequence of colon separated Organisation Keys that fully specifies the Provider Organisation that is responsible for the Episode of Care.

columns.name: episode_key
columns.dc:title: Episode Key
columns.schema:description: This is a number or code assigned to each episode. The Episode Key is unique and stable for each episode at the level of the Provider Organisation.

columns.name: client_key
columns.dc:title: Client Key
columns.schema:description: This is a number or code assigned to each individual client referred to the commissioned organisation. The client identifier is unique and stable for each individual within the Provider Organisation.

columns.name: episode_end_date
columns.dc:title: Episode End Date
columns.schema:description: The date on which an *Episode of Care* is formally or administratively ended

columns.name: client_consent
columns.dc:title: Client Consent to Anonymised Data
columns.schema:description: An indication that the client has consented to their anonymised data being provided to the Department of Health for statistical purposes in planning and improving mental health services.

columns.name: episode_completion_status
columns.dc:title: Episode Completion Status
columns.schema:description: An indication of the completion status of an *Episode of Care*.

columns.name: referral_date
columns.dc:title: Referral Date
columns.schema:description: The date the referrer made the referral.

columns.name: program_type
columns.dc:title: Program Type
columns.schema:description: The overarching program area that an Intake or Episode record is associated with.

columns.name: principal_focus
columns.dc:title: Principal Focus of Treatment Plan
columns.schema:description: The range of activities that best describes the overall services intended to be delivered to the client throughout the course of the episode. For most clients, this will equate to the activities that account for most time spent by the service provider.

columns.name: mental_health_treatment_plan
columns.dc:title: GP Mental Health Treatment Plan Flag
columns.schema:description: An indication of whether a client has a GP mental health treatment plan. A GP should be involved in a referral where appropriate however a mental health treatment plan is not mandatory.

columns.name: homelessness
columns.dc:title: Homelessness Flag
columns.schema:description: An indication of whether the client has been homeless in the 4 weeks prior to the current service episode.

columns.name: client_postcode
columns.dc:title: Area of usual residence, postcode
columns.schema:description: The Australian postcode of the client.

columns.name: labour_force_status
columns.dc:title: Labour Force Status
columns.schema:description: The self-reported status the person currently has in being either in the labour force (employed/unemployed) or not in the labour force, as represented by a code.

columns.name: employment_participation
columns.dc:title: Employment Participation
columns.schema:description: Whether a person in paid employment is employed full-time or part-time, as represented by a code.

columns.name: income_source
columns.dc:title: Source of Cash Income
columns.schema:description: The source from which a person derives the greatest proportion of his/her income, as represented by a code.

columns.name: health_care_card
columns.dc:title: Health Care Card
columns.schema:description: An indication of whether the person is a current holder of a Health Care Card that entitles them to arrange of concessions for Government funded health services.

columns.name: ndis_participant
columns.dc:title: NDIS Participant
columns.schema:description: Is the client a participant in the National Disability Insurance Scheme?, as represented by a code.

columns.name: marital_status
columns.dc:title: Marital Status
columns.schema:description: A person's current relationship status in terms of a couple relationship or, for those not in a couple relationship, the existence of a current or previous registered marriage, as represented by a code.

columns.name: suicide_referral_flag
columns.dc:title: Suicide Referral Flag
columns.schema:description: Identifies those individuals where a recent history of suicide attempt, or suicide risk, was a factor noted in the referral that underpinned the person's needs for assistance at intake or entry to the episode, as represented by a code.

columns.name: principal_diagnosis
columns.dc:title: Principal Diagnosis
columns.schema:description: The Principal Diagnosis is the diagnosis established after study to be chiefly responsible for occasioning the client's care during the current Episode of Care.

columns.name: additional_diagnosis
columns.dc:title: Additional Diagnosis
columns.schema:description: The main additional condition or complaint co-existing with the Principal Diagnosis or arising during the episode of care.

columns.name: medication_antipsychotics
columns.dc:title: Medication - Antipsychotics (N05A)
columns.schema:description: Whether the client is taking prescribed antipsychotics for a mental health condition as assessed at intake assessment, as represented by a code.

columns.name: medication_anxiolytics
columns.dc:title: Medication - Anxiolytics (N05B)
columns.schema:description: Whether the client is taking prescribed anxiolytics for a mental health condition as assessed at intake assessment, as represented by a code.

columns.name: medication_hypnotics
columns.dc:title: Medication - Hypnotics and sedatives (N05C)
columns.schema:description: Whether the client is taking prescribed hypnotics and sedatives for a mental health condition as assessed at intake assessment, as represented by a code.

columns.name: medication_antidepressants
columns.dc:title: Medication - Antidepressants (N06A)
columns.schema:description: Whether the client is taking prescribed antidepressants for a mental health condition as assessed at intake assessment, as represented by a code.

columns.name: medication_psychostimulants
columns.dc:title: Medication - Psychostimulants and nootropics (N06B)
columns.schema:description: Whether the client is taking prescribed psychostimulants and nootropics for a mental health condition as assessed at intake assessment, as represented by a code.

columns.name: referrer_profession
columns.dc:title: Referrer Profession
columns.schema:description: Profession of the provider who referred the client.

columns.name: referrer_organisation_type
columns.dc:title: Referrer Organisation Type
columns.schema:description: Type of organisation in which the referring professional is based.

columns.name: organisation_type_referred_to_at_episode_conclusion
columns.dc:title: Organisation type referred to at Episode conclusion
columns.schema:description: Type of organisation to which the the client was referred at the Episode conclusion.

columns.name: episode_tags
columns.dc:title: Episode Tags
columns.schema:description: List of tags for the episode.
